title: Input Shaft - Disassembly

body.body: The numbers in brackets in the following text refer to the exploded view on
Work from the opposite end from where the clutch assembly is fitted and dismantle the input shaft as follows:
Slide off the plain thrust washer (1).
Mark one side of second gear to show its correct orientation.
Remove the splined lock washers (3 and 4).
Mark one side of sixth gear to show its correct orientation.
Remove sixth gear (6), complete with the splined bush (5) which runs inside the gear.
Note their orientation and remove the splined thrust washer (7) from in front of the circlip between sixth and third/fourth gear.
Remove the circlip (8) from the shaft.
Mark one side of the combined third/fourth gear to show its correct orientation.
Remove the circlip (10) from in front of fifth gear.
Remove the splined thrust washer (11) adjacent to fifth gear.
Mark one side of fifth gear to show its correct orientation.
Remove fifth gear (12), complete with the plain bush (13) which runs inside the gear.
Do not remove the bearing at the clutch end of the input shaft if it is not damaged or worn.
The bearing is pressed onto the shaft and is also pressed into its housing. The bearing and housing are removed from the shaft together and are then separated.
Always wear eye, face, hand protection and overalls when you use a press.
Components can break up when pressed and cause sharp pieces to be thrown at high speed.
Failure to follow the advice above could result in minor to moderate injury.
Support the bearing and housing (15 and 16) on press bars, then press the shaft (14) through the bearing and housing as shown below.

body.name: Remove bearing from input shaft ccbl

body.body: Support the outer circumference of the bearing housing on press bars, then press the bearing through the housing.
